prompt:
You careen on over to the second stall.
Splayed over the table is by far one of the most eclectic assortments of items at this market.

dialogue.prompt: Countless strange knick-knacks are scattered about, ranging from skull ink holders to miniature carved pumpkins. All manner of instruments and audio equipment are heaped in one great pile off to the side: a twelve-string guitar; multiple wind instruments, some bent; amplifiers; and a small electric organ. Bewildering books sporting titles such as “The Entropy of Human Multiplication” and “Pursuing Existence” are stacked in another pile.

Your gaze goes up to the young Englishman manning the table. His long brown locks drape over a vest likely louder than any instrument he could play. The sharp points of his boots peek out from under the colossal flare of his bell bottoms.

Outside of the 70s, the only place this eccentric figure would have fit in was this very market. As he greets you, you notice his accent. Canterbury?
The faint hum of Hammond organ can be heard whirring in the background.
